title: Business Affairs Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Harvey Mudd College
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, interview was 30 minutes and everything went well. Just a few questions regarding my resume. The manager seemed impressed but found out through the website I was no longer being considered. I wish I would have heard from the hiring manager myself regarding the rejection.
Interview Questions: What is your leadership style?

title: Admission Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Harvey Mudd College in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got an email from an assistant requesting an online video interview with the manager. Interview was very professional, went well, and interesting questions were asked. About a week later I got a rejection email, but felt ok about it because the institution was so professional during the whole process. Would definitely apply to more roles in the future.
Interview Questions: Questions about my previous experience, situational questions (how do you work in a group/independently) and many personal questions such as your best achievement, what you're most proud of, etc.

title: Financial Aid Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Harvey Mudd College (Claremont, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I met every person in the department, and had a chance to ask them questions, and vice versa. The whole interview took 2 hours, and it was very relaxed. Everyone made sure I was comfortable, and our conversations had more of a "first meetup of mutual acquaintances" vibe than what I expected.
Interview Questions: What skills do you think are important for a Financial Aid Counselor to have, and which of those do you consider to be your strongest?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Harvey Mudd College (Claremont, CA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: First, I had a phone interview. Then they asked me to do a follow up in person interview. This was a total of 3 hours. I personally think it’s a waste of time to have all potential interviewers do such an extensive interview process. First with the director, then the coordinator and 2 more interviews with other people in the department and then an interview with HR. This took so much time and they don’t even follow up with you afterwards to let you know you didn’t get the job. Nor did they give you the chance and call your references. I just think there’s a different way to handle the interview process. The interview shouldn’t be longer than 45 mins.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you performed good customer service

title: Assistant Director of Annual Giving Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Harvey Mudd College
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen + in-person/on-campus interview. Phone screen was typical - approximately 30 minutes asking why this role, walk them through your resume, etc.   On campus consisted of a full day of interviews with different teams & leadership of department.
Interview Questions: Why are you looking to leave your current role?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Harvey Mudd College
Interview Descriptions: It starts off with a phone interview, where they mainly try to get a feel for who you are and the rundown of the position. Next is the on campus interview, where they try to get a feel to see if you are a good fit. Following that you will receive a office tour to meet the staff.
Interview Questions: why HMC?

title: Math Grader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Harvey Mudd College
Interview Descriptions: Apply through the Math Department, get interviewed by a professor, and then determine your work schedule. It was a pretty smooth process, and I actually enjoyed talking to the professors and figuring out what classes I wanted to grade for. I appreciate the Math Department for taking the time to make sure that the graders are interested in what they are grading for.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to grade for these classes? 
How did you do in these classes?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Harvey Mudd College (Claremont, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Apply Online with your resume and some other details. If chosen then you have 1-2 interviews 1:1 with the professor regarding your background and technical knowledge. Professors are usually very friendly. 

Tip: Speak to the professor before your interview and convey your interest regarding why you are interested and talk about your prior experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do this research?

title: Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Harvey Mudd College (Claremont, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submitted a resume and two references. Made it past two screenings and interviewed with the professor running the research group. It was a fairly informal interview, and it lasted about 30 minutes. Heard back the next week.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Harvey Mudd College (Claremont, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a personal statement online for all C.S. summer research positions. For the one I really wanted I was able to sign up for an interview. After the interview, I got an email from the professor within the next week informing me that I got the position.
Interview Questions: If you were to get stuck while trying to solve a problem, what steps would you take to overcome this hurdle?

title: Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Harvey Mudd College in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: We were asked what we would do in certain situations that would come up with incoming freshmen students. It was in front of 2 administrators but overall it was not super intense. I did not prepare but still got an offer.
Interview Questions: What activity would you plan that would challenge the students to build friendship and community?

title: Design Internship Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Harvey Mudd College (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I met the company at a job fair and gave them my resume on a whim.  Within two weeks I was contacted for an interview.

The interview was a group interview, where me and 5 other applicants were placed in a room with 3 engineers.  The first part consisted of a series of exercises designed to test our critical thinking skills, such as riddles and very basic design tests.  It was actually really enjoyable, and the senior engineers seemed very approachable and nice.

The second phase consisted of the applicants asking questions about the company, followed by a tour of the company.
Interview Questions: How would you test a product before it goes to market?
